My DevOps Story

by
Richa Desai

What is DevOps?

DevOps brings together developers and operations, merging them into a single team, and driving them with the idea of mutual support. DevOps methodology allows delivering software frequently with minor iterable changes.

DevOps enables the users to receive new features and updates frequently. The customers receive new features and bug fixes more often and the company becomes more competitive.

DevOps minimizes the chances of outrages. Even if the outrages do take place, everything can be fixed in a matter of a couple of minutes (sometimes in a matter of a single refresh) and the users wonâ€™t even notice that something is wrong.

What I wish to gain and learn?

Exposure to lots of open source technologies. Since DevOps is all about integration and automation, I'm looking forward to putting the pieces together and make the real use of them.

With good knowledge on DevOps, we can propose solutions to make things easier, repeatable and qualitative.

Week 2

During the second week, we started installing Docker on our pc and we also created a container to run our DevOps website in it. Docker provides us with the same capability as a virtual machine without the overhead. It gives us the flexibility to set our environment and configuration into code and then deploy it.

Week 3

During the third week, I started exploring the various Cloud Platforms we have available to us, and gathering information about them all. I narrowed down to four leading Cloud Platforms, which are: Amazon's AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Open Stack. I plan to gather specific details about each inorder to evaluate and make an informed decision by the next week.

Week 4

This week, I evaluated the data I collected about the various Cloud platforms. I decided to go ahead with Amazon AWS for various reasons. It had a very good reach out. It is very reasonable too, and they offer us a free-tier usage for students along with some credits. The integration process between the various services like API Gateway, Lambda functions, S3, etc is extremely easy and straightforward. Also, a lot of us have taken up Cloud Computing class where we made extensive use of AWS for our Classword and Projects, hence we're very comfortable working on it.

Week 5

We had a guest lecturer from Stack Overflow share some of his thoughts and work with us. It was very fascinating how easy he made the very technical terms for us to understand. He drew comparisons from day-to-day examples and those analogies were self explainatory. I found it very easy to grasp, and remember the concepts clearly till the quiz next week.

Week 6

This week, I worked on deploying our DevOps website on a bucket in AWS S3. I learnt various minute details about this process while implementing it. It was a fun experience of trial and error till I finally had it running. Next, I re-implemented it from the scratch so that I could document all the steps, and screenshot and record the events together. The documentation is now available to all on Clouds/implementation page.
